title.narrative: International: TAMSAT-AgricuLtural EaRly warning sysTem (TAMSAT-ALERT) platform

description.narrative: We propose the development of a new platform, TAMSAT-ALERT*, which will transform proven research in decision support for African agriculture into a platform co-designed with key stakeholders in the agricultural and financial sectors, dedicated to supporting farmers facing time-critical agronomic decisions every season. TAMSAT-ALERT (AgricuLtural dEcision suppoRT) is a methodological framework for assessing weather-related risk to agriculture. TAMSAT has piloted the framework and associated data products in several African countries, including Ghana and Zambia, in partnership with national hydrometeorological services, and leaders in the financial and agricultural sectors. Currently the framework exists as a set of research level code, which can only be run within the TAMSAT group. The proposed project will develop TAMSAT-ALERT into a platform, which can be utilized by the agricultural and financial sectors in Africa and beyond - bridging the gap between research level products and an operational tool. To engage a wide community of stakeholders, the platform will be served through a website, a smartphone app and R/python packages. Our vision is a set of sustainable technologies that can be exploited independently of the project investigators for societal good. *Tropical Applications of Meteorology using SATellite data and ground observations - AgricuLtural dEcision suppoRT system

capital-spend.percentage: This project will develop the TAMSAT-ALERT decision support system into a platform that can be used by the financial and agricultural sectors, for societal benefit in developing nations in Africa and beyond. To this end, our objectives are (with equal priority): 1. Co-design the platform (website, app and open source scripts) with representatives of the national meteorological services (Ghana Meteorological Agency), financial sector (Blue Marble, Risk Shield) and agricultural sector (One Acre Fund). 2. Develop a technologically sound and sustainable platform that meets the needs the needs of our target stakeholder groups in the meteorological, financial and agricultural sectors. 3. Engage a wide range of users from key stakeholder groups, to realise the wide potential of TAMSAT-ALERT to support decision making processes. 4. Sustain the platform in the long term, as one of TAMSAT's operational services.
